Reviews.Title: Much Better Than Expected
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit almost 2 months ago after having someone take a lot of stuff from our small business.  A few years ago I had bought one little wireless camera that took FOREVER to set up and it was very hard to use so I was nervous about trying to set this up.  I finally pulled it all out of the box and started the process and I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to set up.DVR: The DVR already has the hard drive installed in this unit.  I really think I could have been able to do that myself but I'm glad I didn't have to.  I pulled out my old 20" computer monitor from my desktop and started hooking it up.  The DVR came with easy to read set-up guide and also a manual.  I haven't tried to set it up wirelessly yet because I don't think that is something we will be using very often.  There are no buttons on the front but that is probably better since we have a 4 year old around.CAMERAS: My unit did not come with any instructions for setting up the cameras so I searched for Zmodo surveillance camera set up on youtube and got help with that.  Real easy to set up.  I set the system up in my living room to test everything out before trying to install the cameras.  They appear to have a pretty good radius and take very good video in dark lighting.  I have read other reviews and they talked about how you could not read a cars tag and that’s probably true.. However, for us this is just perfect.  It's a good picture at a great price.  If I wanted Blue Ray quality I would have spent a LOT more on the system.If you need a basic system with a lot of cameras at a low price this is a great system.  If you are looking for lots of options, great camera detail and higher prices then get something else.I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Security Cameras
Reviews.Author: Amin R Marcalle Farina "Amin Farina"
Reviews.Content: Great, i used it to install it in a friends house, very pleased with item, no flaws, night vision, water resistant

Reviews.Content: great system, but the support sucks.  Been waiting for days to ask questions. No response.  Had to download a web chat app and no one is on the other end!

Reviews.Title: more complicated than it looks.
Reviews.Author: JULinux
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this thing has all the bells and whistles, and everything works right? Well it's very impressive, I like that it's Linux based, supports 8 cameras, and comes with the 500GB HD.So here is where it went wrong. First of all it may sound strange but the cords for the cameras were wrapped a strange way that made them tangle when pulling the cords out, If they were wraped in circles like the extension cords I got that would be great !!!, and sense the cords are made cheaply, if you hammer a staple on them too hard it easily destroys the cord, or may even cut it in two. At least they can keep the cost down, although I don't know why wrapping it right would. So next was the Networking issue. Subnets are a bad idea. I connected it to a repeater bridge (dd-wrt) because I don't want to string a cable to another building I use for security. So after getting everything set up correctly according to the directions it wouldn't work at all. I have Android phones, Linux PCs, and even tried a Windows PC. Then I found out that you have to manually allow each IP to access the DVR. Not everyone out there is even going to know how to do that.Here is a contradiction. It's a Linux DVR that doesn't work with Linux PCs. Why is this? They provide software to view it and manage it on Windows, and view it on Android and iphone, but why can't you at least view it on Linux? Internet says that you have to modify an existing program some how, and then set up the settings just right, and that if you do all that on Linux the video feed will cut out every now and then.For some reason using two ANDROID phones to view 4 cameras at the same time seems to be too much for the system. But tonight it seems to work.The Hard Drive was defective. I hope the vendor sends me a new one ASAP sense I need this item desperately to protect a rape victim, while I'm at work. Good thing I bought extension cords, or I'd be short because of the one that doesn't work.Anyway it is a good item, it does what you need it to do, I'm just sad it's made in China, and that they had to cut so many corners in order to keep the cost down.

Reviews.Title: Does not Work
Reviews.Author: S. Ahmed
Reviews.Content: I was excited to order this product. However, when I connected it to a monitor and powered it up, the screen remained blank. The software that came with it does not install properly on my Windows 7 machine.  There is no phone number to call for technical support. Their web site is useless. The instruction manual is very poorly written.  I am packing it up and returning this product unless someone can help me make it work.  I am computer literate and manage my own network at home. I know how to hook up electronics.Finally they sent me a RMA but no pre-paid label. I had to ship it at my expense and now asking them to reimburse me. I will report later how it goes.

Reviews.Title: Machine was defective
Reviews.Author: Cheri Rice
Reviews.Content: The first DVR I received was defective and it took my several months of doing what was required from Zmodo.  They even tested the unit and returned it saying it was fine. Just very frustrating. The service from the seller was fine.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: PonySlaystation
Reviews.Content: seems like a cheap kit but it works pretty dang good. night vision is decent for the most part. was worried about how long it would last. Picture quality is decent. For what I paid I can not complain at all. it uses the old school computer monitor output and the tv its on doesn't do that. So I used the hdmi converter box and it works really well. Im going to run it to an hdmi splitter so I can watch it in a few other rooms. one thing for sure is this surveillance system will keep people away from your house. They don't look ugly or obvious but the bad people know whats up. With most houses still without surveillance systems they'll go to an easier house to deal with. This kit is worth every penny if you can install it yourself. I ran the wires in the walls. can see all the way around my house 2000 sq ft on 8000 sq ft lot. any bigger and you probly need the 16 channel or to buy 2 of these.

Reviews.Title: Good CCTV Kit for the price
Reviews.Author: Pedro M. Ariza
Reviews.Content: We have installed and worked with some of the best CCTV systems made and this low cost Zmodo while it can not stand in the same league with them, it can get the job done for the price.

Reviews.Title: easy to use...
Reviews.Author: dogralph
Reviews.Content: this security system was easy to set up and easy to use...only wish that since it is a system with audio that they at least could have sent cables with audio and at least two out the eight cameras with audio as well.  But the cameras were just standard camera and the cables had no audio line...had to order those on my own.  The system itself is easy to set and use and if you don't need audio I would give it five stars.  Can see pretty clear at night time.

Reviews.Title: good system, better daylight than night
Reviews.Author: David Mcgrath
Reviews.Content: for the money it's a good system. the cameras work, not HD, but they're good. hard drive works, not the best directions and my only gripe is who ever rolled up the wires in the factory should be fired. I can't think of a worse way to send them other than in a rats nest. Still haven't figured out how to get it online.

Reviews.Title: Cameras Good but Hardware Rusty
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the cameras but the mounting hardware is already rusting and was just purchased in late January 2013.  I definitely expected the hardware to last longer then just 5 months.

Reviews.Title: see it all, just wish it was a wide lense
Reviews.Author: rodger phillips
Reviews.Content: these work perfect and its what i have been looking for, very well product and  not much tool needed,  help you keep and eye on the place without the high cost

Reviews.Content: Very good system for price, setup for access from Internet can be tricky, but works out once setup. System emails pictures of motion from each camera, night vision does need some outdoor light around property for best results.

Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT A 4 CHANNEL FRIST AND LIKE IT BUT I WANTED MORE TO GO ALL AROUND MY 1 ACRE YARD SO I GOT A 8 CHANNEL  GAVE MY SON THE 4 CHANNEL FOR HIS HOME THE PRICE WAS GOOD FOR BOTH OF THEM

Reviews.Title: Good buy especially for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Martin
Reviews.Content: Ok, the good, the bad, and the ugly....these are good general purpose monitoring cameras.  I find the video quality to be good enough for close surveillance around the house both during the day (color) and at night (black and white).  I do like the video review features with review speeds from1/4 to 16X with pause.  The not so good is these are fixed focus cameras.  You cannot zoom in or out.  The field of view is not as wide as I hoped probably about 15 feet.  Because of that you need all 8 cameras to capture a wide area.  I have two on each corner.  I have not been able to retrieve files from the hard drive.  I can view past recordings, but haven't been able to copy files for transfer or deletion. There may be a way I just haven't figured it out.  Lessons learned the hard way, the cable ends are specific to the cameras and processor.  If you route them the wrong you'll have to reroute them or buy adapters.  The adapters are hard to find for the male ends.  I'm very happy with my purchase and my wife likes the added security.  Hope this helps.
